name: Residents Affected by State Boil Water Order Should Follow CDC Guidance
description: In light of the California-American Water Company boil water advisory issued today, the County would like to remind affected residents of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommended steps during an advisory.

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
In light of the California-American Water Company boil water advisory issued today, the County would like to remind affected residents of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommended steps during an advisory.
Customers affected by this advisory include those within the City of Imperial Beach, the City of Coronado south of Fiddler’s Cove, and certain residents within the City of San Diego neighborhoods of Nestor and Otay. The City of Coronado north of Fiddler’s Cove is unaffected.
When a Boil Water Advisory is in effect, affected customers should use bottled water or boiled tap water for drinking, brushing teeth, and to prepare and cook food. When boiling water, bring it to a full rolling boil for at least one minute, and then allow it to cool before use. You should be careful not to swallow water when bathing or showering, and to supervise young children and babies when being bathed.
The County is working with impacted healthcare facilities and restaurants to help safeguard the public’s health and safety.
Customers with questions can call Cal-Am Water at 1-888-237-1333 or visit www.amwater.com for more information.
For more information visit: CDC Boil Water Advisory.
